title: Fact Check: Don’t fall for this morphed picture of Defence Minister Rajnath Singh putting nimbu-mirchi on the border | Newsmobile
author: newsmobile.in
vclaim:
A picture of Defence Minister Rajnath Singh is doing rounds on social media claiming that he is putting Nimbu-Mirchi (lemon and chilli) on the border. The post claims that bullets from another country cannot enter our country and Defence Minister has been compared to Lord Hanuman and how he helped Karn in Mahabharata.

The post also claims that one day these superstitions will ruin our country.

We found the same picture on as well. Other posts with the same picture can be seen , and .

NewsMobile fact-checked the above post and found it to be misleading.

On putting the picture through Google Reverse Image Search, we found the original picture of the Defence Minister, Rajnath Singh in an article by dated October 9, 2019.

The picture caption read, “Indian Defense Minister Rajnath Singh writes onto a Rafale jet fighter as a ritual gesture during a handover ceremony at the Dassault Aviation plant in Merignac, near Bordeaux, southwestern France.”

Further, we found this picture in another article on The Siasat Daily, dated October 9, 2019, claiming that Rajnath Singh performs Shastra Puja in Paris after receiving first Rafael Fighter Jet.

Hence, the above information clearly states that the picture Defence Minister Rajnath Singh is morphed and claims of putting ‘Nimbu Mirchi’ on the borders are FALSE. Don’t fall for these misleading claims.
